isis.stitle: FRONT NON-DRIVE STEERING AXLE: ROCKWELL - INSPECTION - CHECKING THE KNUCKLE BUSHINGS FOR WEAR

svcproc.title: CHECKING THE KNUCKLE BUSHINGS FOR WEAR

step1.para: Put blocks in front and behind the rear wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving.

warning.para: Do not work under a vehicle only supported by jack stands. Jack stands can slip or fall over and cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: Use a jack to raise the vehicle until the wheels are off the ground. Support the vehicle with safety stands.
Check the upper knuckle bushing for wear. Install a dial indicator so that the base is on the I-beam and that the tip is against the side of the top of the knuckle ( Figure 6).

figure.caption: Figure 6. Checking the Knuckle Bushings for Wear

step1.para: Set the dial indicator on zero (0).

note.para: If one bushing must be replaced, replace both bushings in the knuckle.

step1.para: Move the top of the tire side to side towards and away from the vehicle. If the dial indicator moves a total of 0.010 inch (0.254 mm), the upper bushing is worn or damaged ( Figure 6). Replace both bushings. Refer to ASSEMBLE.
Check the lower knuckle bushing. Install a dial indicator so that the base is on the I-beam and the tip is against the side of the bottom of the knuckle ( Figure 7).

figure.caption: Figure 7. Checking The Lower Knuckle Bushing

step1.para: Set the dial indicator on zero (0).

Move the bottom of the tire side to side towards and away from the vehicle. If the dial indicator moves a total of 0.010 inch (0.25mm), the lower bushing is worn or damaged. Replace both bushings. Refer to ASSEMBLE .
